sections.title: Create and display inline ads
sections.chapter: Working with the built-in capabilities of the SDK

inlineContent.text: This tutorial will guide you how to create and display inline ads. An inline ad is an ad created to be displayed in your view hierarchy.
We will continue to build the app, so be sure to follow all the previous tutorials. You can download
which has already implemented all steps from this tutorial.
Your
is ready for creating advertisements, so in this section, we will create an
for future ad display.
Let’s create
in the
folder. Since we plan to display multiple ads in the list, we will use it to display a single ad.
Create an
and an
. In this case, the
conform to the
protocol for displaying in the list. Also, we pass the
to the initialiser, which will be used to create the ad later.
To create advertisements, we use the
method. The most important parameter now is
, which describes the request that will be sent to the server to receive ads. Let’s pass it through the initialiser and look at it in more detail later.
If you successfully create an ad, you will receive the downloaded
object. You can think of it as a ViewModel that holds the data and state of your ad. We store this object and pass it to
If we have an
object, it remains to add a
has
, which is the presentation layer of your inline ad.
Our
can load and display ads, but how can we understand what size the
should be? In this section we will deal with this question.

tasks.title: Defining the size of the inline ad

inlineContent.text: As we already know,
stores advertising data. Let’s try to get it! We can obtain all possible advertising data using
. This is the one we will use to obtain the size data.
The
is optional, but you can be sure that if you have not called the
method, the object will be present in the
We are interested in
, which is optional. We have implemented the logic so that in cases where it is not present, we will use the 2:1 ratio.
The last step is to pass this value to the
. After that, we can be sure that the ad size is displayed correctly.
Our
is ready to load and display a single ad. In this section, we will create a new screen to display the list of advertisements.
Let’s create
in the
folder.

We start the process of loading all the ads as soon as the screen appears, but you can implement your own logic with bash loading on scroll, or load ads before the screen is displayed, it all depends on your needs.
This screen is responsible for creating
and displaying
Let’s focus our attention on the
method, because it is in this method that we will implement the logic for filling the
You can also use
, but we use
in this tutorial because it is more commonly used.
As you may recall, to create an ad, we need an
. It describes the request that will be sent to the server to get an ad. The only mandatory field when creating is
or
. Content unit is unique ID of a content space. We will create several
with the same
Time to load ads! Since the loading is async and we want to load all the ads in parallel, we’ll use a
, and sort everything by
after downloading.
Our screen is ready, now we just need to add it to the navigation stack. To do this, let’s return to
Let’s add the
to the
and implement a navigation to the
. Now, if you did everything right, you can launch the app and see the list of advertisement. Congratulations!

tasks.title: Creating and displaying a list of advertisements

inlineContent.text: The AdSDK includes the functionality of tracking the percentage of ad visibility. The main work on setting up tracking is not on the app developer, but a small step is also required from the developer to ensure that the tracking works correctly.
You will learn more about tracking events on a
, and in this section, we will add functionality that will unlock the tracking of ad visibility on the screen.
If your ad is on a screen that has
, it is useful for advertisers to track the percentage of the ad’s visibility on the screen. Let’s go back to
To unlock this tracking in the SDK, all we need to do is add the
modifier to our
. Now the SDK will be able to track the percentage of
visibility on the screen, and advertisers will be able to set up ads for tracking.

abstract.text: A full-screen advertisement that fills the host app’s interface is known as an interstitial ad. In this tutorial we are going to add interstitial ad into our application.
